techmeme.title: Emmanuel Macron joins growing European criticism of Musk, says "the owner of one of the world's largest social networks" is "intervening directly in elections" (Jon Henley/The Guardian)
Chinese VCs are targeting failed founders' personal assets and blacklisting them as debtors when they don't pay, throwing China's funding ecosystem into crisis (Financial Times)
Intel launches Arrow Lake Core Ultra 200U, 200H, and 200HX laptop CPUs; none of the CPUs meet the AI performance requirements for Microsoft's Copilot+ (Andrew Cunningham/Ars Technica)
Ring announces a new partnership with fire safety brand Kidde to launch smart smoke and carbon monoxide alarms, launching for $54.97 and $74.97 in April 2025 (Jennifer Pattison Tuohy/The Verge)
Disney and Fubo announce a deal wherein Disney will combine Hulu + Live TV with Fubo in a joint venture and Fubo will drop its Venu Sports antitrust lawsuit (Todd Spangler/Variety)
